 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }

 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

              <span></span>Issue list<span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    k<kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    j<kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                up/down in the list<span class="key-tip"><!---->up/down in the list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    o<kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      rory@rorym.cnamara.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/2041323229" title="rory@rorym.cnamara.com"><!---->rory@rorym.cnamara.com<!----></a>

          <small class="byline">

        Description #1 by rory@rorym.cnamara.com (Dec 7, 2022)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by rory@rorym.cnamara.com (Dec 7, 2022)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by rory@rorym.cnamara.com (Dec 7, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by rory@rorym.cnamara.com (Dec 7, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>When preparing to mount a user's cryptohome, cryptohomed will unsafely recursively delete a directory in a chronos controlled path. A race condition exists to insert symbolic links which can result in the arbitrary deletion of files and directories across the filesystem.<span class="line"><!---->When preparing to mount a user's cryptohome, cryptohomed will unsafely recursively delete a directory in a chronos controlled path. A race condition exists to insert symbolic links which can result in the arbitrary deletion of files and directories across the filesystem.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Google Chrome	107.0.5304.110 (Official Build) (64-bit) <span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome	107.0.5304.110 (Official Build) (64-bit) <!----></span><br>Revision	2a558545ab7e6fb8177002bf44d4fc1717cb2998<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/2a558545ab7e6fb8177002bf44d4fc1717cb2998"><!---->Revision	2a558545ab7e6fb8177002bf44d4fc1717cb2998<!----></a>-refs/branch-heads/5304@{#1202}<span class="line"><!---->-refs/branch-heads/5304@{#1202}<!----></span><br>Platform	15117.112.0 (Official Build) stable-channel eve<span class="line"><!---->Platform	15117.112.0 (Official Build) stable-channel eve<!----></span><br>Firmware Version	Google_Eve.9584.230.0<span class="line"><!---->Firmware Version	Google_Eve.9584.230.0<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Execute the attached shell script as follows:<span class="line"><!---->Execute the attached shell script as follows:<!----></span><br><br>sh <(cat arbitrarydelete.sh)<span class="line"><!---->sh &lt;(cat arbitrarydelete.sh)<!----></span><br><br>Observe upon completion the file /run/agetty.reload is deleted. Note that this vulnerability is a race condition and therefore the time to execute can vary greatly. Each period output by the script indicates one iteration, to identify if the script has hung.<span class="line"><!---->Observe upon completion the file /run/agetty.reload is deleted. Note that this vulnerability is a race condition and therefore the time to execute can vary greatly. Each period output by the script indicates one iteration, to identify if the script has hung.<!----></span><br><br>(agetty.reload is a file that exists by default on my system, is owned by root and isn't important, so was selected for this proof of concept. Other files can be targeted)<span class="line"><!---->(agetty.reload is a file that exists by default on my system, is owned by root and isn't important, so was selected for this proof of concept. Other files can be targeted)<!----></span><br><br>DETAILS<span class="line"><!---->DETAILS<!----></span><br>When cryptohome attempts to mount /home/chronos/u-[hash], it will first delete this directory if it exists [1]. /home/chronos is owned by chronos and therefore this directory can be created before a cryptohome mount request is executed.<span class="line"><!---->When cryptohome attempts to mount /home/chronos/u-[hash], it will first delete this directory if it exists [1]. /home/chronos is owned by chronos and therefore this directory can be created before a cryptohome mount request is executed.<!----></span><br><br>The deletion of /home/chronos/u-[hash], if present, is performed by DoDeleteFile, with recursive set to true. When recursive is true, a FileEnumerator is used to identify files inside the target directory to be deleted [2].<span class="line"><!---->The deletion of /home/chronos/u-[hash], if present, is performed by DoDeleteFile, with recursive set to true. When recursive is true, a FileEnumerator is used to identify files inside the target directory to be deleted [2].<!----></span><br><br>If a directory is created /home/chronos/u-[hash]/EXPLOIT, inside which contains a file /home/chronos/u-[hash]/EXPLOIT/agetty.reload, the FileEnumerator will include this file in it's list which is later iterated for deletion [3]. If between the creation of the FileEnumerator [2] and the execution of unlink [3], the /home/chronos/u-[hash]/EXPLOIT directory is replaced with a symbolic link to /run, the unlink will then delete /run/agetty.reload via /home/chronos/u-[hash]/EXPLOIT/agetty.reload.<span class="line"><!---->If a directory is created /home/chronos/u-[hash]/EXPLOIT, inside which contains a file /home/chronos/u-[hash]/EXPLOIT/agetty.reload, the FileEnumerator will include this file in it's list which is later iterated for deletion [3]. If between the creation of the FileEnumerator [2] and the execution of unlink [3], the /home/chronos/u-[hash]/EXPLOIT directory is replaced with a symbolic link to /run, the unlink will then delete /run/agetty.reload via /home/chronos/u-[hash]/EXPLOIT/agetty.reload.<!----></span><br><br>Since this is a tight race, 1000 directories are created, /home/chronos/u-[hash]/EXPLOIT.0 to /home/chronos/u-[hash]/EXPLOIT.999. When the proof of concept identifies that these directories are being deleted, it will switch all directories for the symbolic link to /run, hopefully resulting in cryptohome traversing these symbolic links while the recursive delete is executed.<span class="line"><!---->Since this is a tight race, 1000 directories are created, /home/chronos/u-[hash]/EXPLOIT.0 to /home/chronos/u-[hash]/EXPLOIT.999. When the proof of concept identifies that these directories are being deleted, it will switch all directories for the symbolic link to /run, hopefully resulting in cryptohome traversing these symbolic links while the recursive delete is executed.<!----></span><br><br>This vulnerability is cleanly retriable but quite unreliable, and therefore sometimes a large number of attempts are required to be successful.<span class="line"><!---->This vulnerability is cleanly retriable but quite unreliable, and therefore sometimes a large number of attempts are required to be successful.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/main/cryptohome/storage/mount_helper.cc#382<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/main/cryptohome/storage/mount_helper.cc#382"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/main/cryptohome/storage/mount_helper.cc#382<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/base/files/file_util_posix.cc#301<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/base/files/file_util_posix.cc#301"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/base/files/file_util_posix.cc#301<!----></a><br>[3] <span class="line"><!---->[3] <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/base/files/file_util_posix.cc#309<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/base/files/file_util_posix.cc#309"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/base/files/file_util_posix.cc#309<!----></a><br><br>Requirements<span class="line"><!---->Requirements<!----></span><br>- None<span class="line"><!---->- None<!----></span><br><br>Impact<span class="line"><!---->Impact<!----></span><br>- Arbitrary deletion of files and directories across the filesystem. This vulnerability can be used to target single files/directories but can be run repeatedly to delete directory trees.<span class="line"><!---->- Arbitrary deletion of files and directories across the filesystem. This vulnerability can be used to target single files/directories but can be run repeatedly to delete directory trees.<!----></span><br><br>Recommendation<span class="line"><!---->Recommendation<!----></span><br>- Don't perform recursive deletions as root into chronos owned directory trees, at least without SafeFD<span class="line"><!---->- Don't perform recursive deletions as root into chronos owned directory trees, at least without SafeFD<!----></span><br>- I've exploited FileEnumerator based races a couple of times now (cf 1115662), it may be appropriate to require FileEnumerator usage to be paired with SafeFD<span class="line"><!---->- I've exploited FileEnumerator based races a couple of times now (cf 1115662), it may be appropriate to require FileEnumerator usage to be paired with SafeFD<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
      
        
          
      
        
          
          arbitrarydelete.sh<b><!---->arbitrarydelete.sh<!----></b>
          
        <div class="filename">
          
          <b><!---->arbitrarydelete.sh<!----></b>
          
        </div>

        I am not familiar with FileEnumerator's flag behavior. The SHOW_SYM_LINK flag is on for FileEnumerator. When a directory is a symlink to /run, will FileEnumerator follows the link throught the Next() call? No because the directory is actually becoming a symlink file. So the race is that:<span class="line"><!---->I am not familiar with FileEnumerator's flag behavior. The SHOW_SYM_LINK flag is on for FileEnumerator. When a directory is a symlink to /run, will FileEnumerator follows the link throught the Next() call? No because the directory is actually becoming a symlink file. So the race is that:<!----></span><br>1. FileEnumerator checks a directory D can be traversed.<span class="line"><!---->1. FileEnumerator checks a directory D can be traversed.<!----></span><br>2. FileEnumerator enters the directory D.<span class="line"><!---->2. FileEnumerator enters the directory D.<!----></span><br>3. FileEnumerator traverses the files of D and starts to call unlink($D/filename) on each file.<span class="line"><!---->3. FileEnumerator traverses the files of D and starts to call unlink($D/filename) on each file.<!----></span><br><br>if we change the directory D to a symlink of any other directory, between step 2 and 3 the $D/filename is pointing to some other files. <span class="line"><!---->if we change the directory D to a symlink of any other directory, between step 2 and 3 the $D/filename is pointing to some other files. <!----></span><br><br>Not sure if unlinkat() is a better replacement of unlink.<span class="line"><!---->Not sure if unlinkat() is a better replacement of unlink.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        #c6<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c6"><!---->#c6<!----></a>: Yes, it may not be a complete fix but my naive thought is that it should stop some/all symlink attacks in this case, as it can guarantee no symlinks in the entire tree when calling Unlink.<span class="line"><!---->: Yes, it may not be a complete fix but my naive thought is that it should stop some/all symlink attacks in this case, as it can guarantee no symlinks in the entire tree when calling Unlink.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This doesn't reproduce for me using rmdir directly. I wrote the following minimal PoC:<span class="line"><!---->This doesn't reproduce for me using rmdir directly. I wrote the following minimal PoC:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>#include <assert.h><span class="line"><!---->#include &lt;assert.h&gt;<!----></span><br>#include <fcntl.h><span class="line"><!---->#include &lt;fcntl.h&gt;<!----></span><br>#include <stdio.h><span class="line"><!---->#include &lt;stdio.h&gt;<!----></span><br>#include <unistd.h><span class="line"><!---->int main() {<!----></span><br>    if (mkdirat(AT_FDCWD, "test-dir", 700)) {<span class="line"><!---->    if (mkdirat(AT_FDCWD, "test-dir", 700)) {<!----></span><br> }<!----></span><br><br>    if (symlinkat("test-dir", AT_FDCWD, "to-unlink")) {<span class="line"><!---->    if (symlinkat("test-dir", AT_FDCWD, "to-unlink")) {<!----></span><br> class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br><br>    if (rmdir("to-unlink")) {<span class="line"><!---->    if (rmdir("to-unlink")) {<!----></span><br>        perror("rmdir");<span class="line"><!---->        perror("rmdir");<!----></span><br>        return 1;<span class="line"><!---->        return 1;<!----></span><br>        if (unlinkat(AT_FDCWD, "to-unlink", 0)) {<span class="line"><!---->        if (unlinkat(AT_FDCWD, "to-unlink", 0)) {<!----></span><br>            perror("unlinkat('to-unlink')");<span class="line"><!---->            perror("unlinkat('to-unlink')");<!----></span><br>            return 1;<span class="line"><!---->            return 1;<!----></span><br>        }<span class="line"><!---->        }<!----></span><br>    } else {<span class="line"><!---->    } else {<!----></span><br>        if (unlinkat(AT_FDCWD, "to-unlink", 0)) {<span class="line"><!---->        if (unlinkat(AT_FDCWD, "to-unlink", 0)) {<!----></span><br>            perror("unlinkat('to-unlink')");<span class="line"><!---->            perror("unlinkat('to-unlink')");<!----></span><br>        }<span class="line"><!---->        }<!----></span><br>    }<span {<!----></span><br>        perror("unlinkat");<span class="line"><!---->        perror("unlinkat");<!----></span><br>        return 1;<span class="line"><!---->        return 1;<!----></span><br> directory<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Furthermore if I look for the symlink and its target, both are still there:<span class="line"><!---->Furthermore if I look for the symlink and its target, both are still there:<!----></span><br>d-w-r-xr-T.  2 root    root        40 Mar  3 09:34 test-dir<span class="line"><!---->d-w-r-xr-T.  2 root    root        40         #c22<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c22"><!---->#c22<!----></a>: The expectation is the symlink is part of the path, not the final component, e.g /a/b/c where b is a symlink and c is to-be-deleted. In the above PoC the EXPLOIT directory is a symlink and .../EXPLOIT/agetty.reload is the deletion target.<span class="line"><!---->: The expectation is the symlink is part of the path, not the final component, e.g /a/b/c where b is a symlink and c is to-be-deleted. In the above PoC the EXPLOIT directory is a symlink and .../EXPLOIT/agetty.reload is the deletion target.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Here is a possible fix, but we would still probably need to move other usage of libchrome's DeletePath and DeleteFile over to the newer functions in libbrillo.<span class="line"><!---->Here is a possible fix, but we would still probably need to move other usage of libchrome's DeletePath and DeleteFile over to the newer functions in libbrillo.<!----></span><br><br>We could see if libchrome would pick up the fixed versions, but that is a harder sell because Chrome doesn't have to worry about UID privilege escalation (except maybe in user namespaces).<span class="line"><!---->We could see if libchrome would pick up the fixed versions, but that is a harder sell because Chrome doesn't have to worry about UID privilege escalation (except maybe in user namespaces).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

We do not want ENOENT for contents being<span class="line"><!---->during a recursive Rmdir. We do not want ENOENT for contents being<!----></span><br>conflated with ENOENT for the target directory. This should make this<span class="line"><!---->conflated with ENOENT for the target directory. This should make this<!----></span><br>less prone to failure when multiple processes are deleting overlapping<span class="line"><!---->less prone to failure when multiple processes are deleting overlapping<!----></span><br>paths.<span class="line"><!---->paths.<!----></span><br><br>This also stops logging errors when Rmdir is called for a file since<span class="line"><!---->This also stops logging errors when Rmdir is called for a file since<!----></span><br>that is an expected case in brillo::DeleteFile.<span class="line"><!---->that is an expected case in brillo::DeleteFile.<!----></span><br><br>BUG=chromium:1398990<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1398990" title="Security: ChromeOS Arbitrary Root File         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

This should make this<!----></span><br>less prone to failure when multiple processes are deleting overlapping<span class="line"><!---->less prone to failure when multiple processes are deleting overlapping<!----></span><br>paths.<span class="line"><!---->paths.<!----></span><br><br>This also stops logging errors when Rmdir is called for a file since<span class="line"><!---->This also stops logging errors when Rmdir is called for a file since<!----></span><br>that is an expected case in brillo::DeleteFile.<span class="line"><!---->that is an expected case in brillo::DeleteFile.<!----></span><br><br>BUG=chromium:1398990<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1398990" title="Security: ChromeOS Arbitrary Root File DCHECKs from the original change aren't present in 108.<span class="line"><!---->  The path DCHECKs from the original change aren't present in 108.<!----></span><br>  Kept the 108 code without the DCHECKs but applied the fixes.<span class="line"><!---->  Kept the 108 code without the DCHECKs but applied the fixes.<!----></span><br><br>Use SafeFD rather than libchrome to do delete operations because<span class="line"><!---->Use SafeFD rather than libchrome to do delete operations because<!----></span><br>recursion is prone to ToCToU races.<span class="line"><!---->recursion is prone to            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;

          width: 100%;

          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }

 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };

  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }

    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }

    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }

          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>
      
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

          <slot></slot>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        Description #1 by rory@rorym.cnamara.com (Dec 7, 2022)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by rory@rorym.cnamara.com (Dec 7, 2022)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by rory@rorym.cnamara.com (Dec 7, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by rory@rorym.cnamara.com (Dec 7, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>When preparing to mount a user's cryptohome, cryptohomed will unsafely recursively delete a directory in a chronos controlled path. A race condition exists to insert symbolic links which can result in the arbitrary deletion of files and directories across the filesystem.<span class="line"><!---->When preparing to mount a user's cryptohome, cryptohomed will unsafely recursively delete a directory in a chronos controlled path. A race condition exists to insert symbolic links which can result in the arbitrary deletion of files and directories across the filesystem.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Google Chrome	107.0.5304.110 (Official Build) (64-bit) <span class="line"><!---->Google Chrome	107.0.5304.110 (Official Build) (64-bit) <!----></span><br>Revision	2a558545ab7e6fb8177002bf44d4fc1717cb2998<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/2a558545ab7e6fb8177002bf44d4fc1717cb2998"><!---->Revision	2a558545ab7e6fb8177002bf44d4fc1717cb2998<!----></a>-refs/branch-heads/5304@{#1202}<span class="line"><!---->-refs/branch-heads/5304@{#1202}<!----></span><br>Platform	15117.112.0 (Official Build) stable-channel eve<span class="line"><!---->Platform	15117.112.0 (Official Build) stable-channel eve<!----></span><br>Firmware Version	Google_Eve.9584.230.0<span class="line"><!---->Firmware Version	Google_Eve.9584.230.0<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Execute the attached shell script as follows:<span class="line"><!---->Execute the attached shell script as follows:<!----></span><br><br>sh <(cat arbitrarydelete.sh)<span class="line"><!---->sh &lt;(cat arbitrarydelete.sh)<!----></span><br><br>Observe upon completion the file /run/agetty.reload is deleted. Note that this vulnerability is a race condition and therefore the time to execute can vary greatly. Each period output by the script indicates one iteration, to identify if the script has hung.<span class="line"><!---->Observe upon completion the file /run/agetty.reload is deleted. Note that this vulnerability is a race condition and therefore the time to execute can vary greatly. Each period output by the script indicates one iteration, to identify if the script has hung.<!----></span><br><br>(agetty.reload is a file that exists by default on my system, is owned by root and isn't important, so was selected for this proof of concept. Other files can be targeted)<span class="line"><!---->(agetty.reload is a file that exists by default on my system, is owned by root and isn't important, so was selected for this proof of concept. Other files can be targeted)<!----></span><br><br>DETAILS<span class="line"><!---->DETAILS<!----></span><br>When cryptohome attempts to mount /home/chronos/u-[hash], it will first delete this directory if it exists [1]. /home/chronos is owned by chronos and therefore this directory can be created before a cryptohome mount request is executed.<span class="line"><!---->When cryptohome attempts to mount /home/chronos/u-[hash], it will first delete this directory if it exists [1]. /home/chronos is owned by chronos and therefore this directory can be created before a cryptohome mount request is executed.<!----></span><br><br>The deletion of /home/chronos/u-[hash], if present, is performed by DoDeleteFile, with recursive set to true. When recursive is true, a FileEnumerator is used to identify files inside the target directory to be deleted [2].<span class="line"><!---->The deletion of /home/chronos/u-[hash], if present, is performed by DoDeleteFile, with recursive set to true. When recursive is true, a FileEnumerator is used to identify files inside the target directory to be deleted [2].<!----></span><br><br>If a directory is created /home/chronos/u-[hash]/EXPLOIT, inside which contains a file /home/chronos/u-[hash]/EXPLOIT/agetty.reload, the FileEnumerator will include this file in it's list which is later iterated for deletion [3]. If between the creation of the FileEnumerator [2] and the execution of unlink [3], the /home/chronos/u-[hash]/EXPLOIT directory is replaced with a symbolic link to /run, the unlink will then delete /run/agetty.reload via /home/chronos/u-[hash]/EXPLOIT/agetty.reload.<span class="line"><!---->If a directory is created /home/chronos/u-[hash]/EXPLOIT, inside which contains a file /home/chronos/u-[hash]/EXPLOIT/agetty.reload, the FileEnumerator will include this file in it's list which is later iterated for deletion [3]. If between the creation of the FileEnumerator [2] and the execution of unlink [3], the /home/chronos/u-[hash]/EXPLOIT directory is replaced with a symbolic link to /run, the unlink will then delete /run/agetty.reload via /home/chronos/u-[hash]/EXPLOIT/agetty.reload.<!----></span><br><br>Since this is a tight race, 1000 directories are created, /home/chronos/u-[hash]/EXPLOIT.0 to /home/chronos/u-[hash]/EXPLOIT.999. When the proof of concept identifies that these directories are being deleted, it will switch all directories for the symbolic link to /run, hopefully resulting in cryptohome traversing these symbolic links while the recursive delete is executed.<span class="line"><!---->Since this is a tight race, 1000 directories are created, /home/chronos/u-[hash]/EXPLOIT.0 to /home/chronos/u-[hash]/EXPLOIT.999. When the proof of concept identifies that these directories are being deleted, it will switch all directories for the symbolic link to /run, hopefully resulting in cryptohome traversing these symbolic links while the recursive delete is executed.<!----></span><br><br>This vulnerability is cleanly retriable but quite unreliable, and therefore sometimes a large number of attempts are required to be successful.<span class="line"><!---->This vulnerability is cleanly retriable but quite unreliable, and therefore sometimes a large number of attempts are required to be successful.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/main/cryptohome/storage/mount_helper.cc#382<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/main/cryptohome/storage/mount_helper.cc#382"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/main/cryptohome/storage/mount_helper.cc#382<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/base/files/file_util_posix.cc#301<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/base/files/file_util_posix.cc#301"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/base/files/file_util_posix.cc#301<!----></a><br>[3] <span class="line"><!---->[3] <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/base/files/file_util_posix.cc#309<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/base/files/file_util_posix.cc#309"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/base/files/file_util_posix.cc#309<!----></a><br><br>Requirements<span class="line"><!---->Requirements<!----></span><br>- None<span class="line"><!---->- None<!----></span><br><br>Impact<span class="line"><!---->Impact<!----></span><br>- Arbitrary deletion of files and directories across the filesystem. This vulnerability can be used to target single files/directories but can be run repeatedly to delete directory trees.<span class="line"><!---->- Arbitrary deletion of files and directories across the filesystem. This vulnerability can be used to target single files/directories but can be run repeatedly to delete directory trees.<!----></span><br><br>Recommendation<span class="line"><!---->Recommendation<!----></span><br>- Don't perform recursive deletions as root into chronos owned directory trees, at least without SafeFD<span class="line"><!---->- Don't perform recursive deletions as root into chronos owned directory trees, at least without SafeFD<!----></span><br>- I've exploited FileEnumerator based races a couple of times now (cf 1115662), it may be appropriate to require FileEnumerator usage to be paired with SafeFD<span class="line"><!---->- I've exploited FileEnumerator based races a couple of times now (cf 1115662), it may be appropriate to require FileEnumerator usage to be paired with SafeFD<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
      
        
          
      
        
          
          arbitrarydelete.sh<b><!---->arbitrarydelete.sh<!----></b>
          
        <div class="filename">
          
          <b><!---->arbitrarydelete.sh<!----></b>
          
        </div>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1398990#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        I am not familiar with FileEnumerator's flag behavior. The SHOW_SYM_LINK flag is on for FileEnumerator. When a directory is a symlink to /run, will FileEnumerator follows the link throught the Next() call? No because the directory is actually becoming a symlink file. So the race is that:<span class="line"><!---->I am not familiar with FileEnumerator's flag behavior. The SHOW_SYM_LINK flag is on for FileEnumerator. When a directory is a symlink to /run, will FileEnumerator follows the link throught the Next() call? No because the directory is actually becoming a symlink file. So the race is that:<!----></span><br>1. FileEnumerator checks a directory D can be traversed.<span class="line"><!---->1. FileEnumerator checks a directory D can be traversed.<!----></span><br>2. FileEnumerator enters the directory D.<span class="line"><!---->2. FileEnumerator enters the directory D.<!----></span><br>3. FileEnumerator traverses the files of D and starts to call unlink($D/filename) on each file.<span class="line"><!---->3. FileEnumerator traverses the files of D and starts to call unlink($D/filename) on each file.<!----></span><br><br>if we change the directory D to a symlink of any other directory, between step 2 and 3 the $D/filename is pointing to some other files. <span class="line"><!---->if we change the directory D to a symlink of any other directory, between step 2 and 3 the $D/filename is pointing to some other files. <!----></span><br><br>Not sure if unlinkat() is a better replacement of unlink.<span class="line"><!---->Not sure if unlinkat() is a better replacement of unlink.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        #c6<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c6"><!---->#c6<!----></a>: Yes, it may not be a complete fix but my naive thought is that it should stop some/all symlink attacks in this case, as it can guarantee no symlinks in the entire tree when calling Unlink.<span class="line"><!---->: Yes, it may not be a complete fix but my naive thought is that it should stop some/all symlink attacks in this case, as it can guarantee no symlinks in the entire tree when calling Unlink.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This doesn't reproduce for me using rmdir directly. I wrote the following minimal PoC:<span class="line"><!---->This doesn't reproduce for me using rmdir directly. I wrote the following minimal PoC:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>#include <assert.h><span class="line"><!---->#include &lt;assert.h&gt;<!----></span><br>#include <fcntl.h><span class="line"><!---->#include &lt;fcntl.h&gt;<!----></span><br>#include <stdio.h><span class="line"><!---->#include &lt;stdio.h&gt;<!----></span><br>#include <unistd.h><span class="line"><!---->#include &lt;unistd.h&gt;<!----></span><br><br>#include <sys/stat.h><span class="line"><!---->#include &lt;sys/stat.h&gt;<!----></span><br><br>int main() {<span class="line"><!---->int main() {<!----></span><br>    if (mkdirat(AT_FDCWD, "test-dir", 700)) {<span class="line"><!---->    if (mkdirat(AT_FDCWD, "test-dir", 700)) {<!----></span><br>        perror("mkdirat");<span class="line"><!---->        perror("mkdirat");<!----></span><br>        return 1;<span class="line"><!---->        return 1;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br><br>    if (symlinkat("test-dir", AT_FDCWD, "to-unlink")) {<span class="line"><!---->    if (symlinkat("test-dir", AT_FDCWD, "to-unlink")) {<!----></span><br>        perror("symlinkat");<span class="line"><!---->        perror("symlinkat");<!----></span><br>        return 1;<span class="line"><!---->        return 1;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br><br>    if (rmdir("to-unlink")) {<span class="line"><!---->    if (rmdir("to-unlink")) {<!----></span><br>        perror("rmdir");<span class="line"><!---->        perror("rmdir");<!----></span><br>        return 1;<span class="line"><!---->        return 1;<!----></span><br>        if (unlinkat(AT_FDCWD, "to-unlink", 0)) {<span class="line"><!---->        if (unlinkat(AT_FDCWD, "to-unlink", 0)) {<!----></span><br>            perror("unlinkat('to-unlink')");<span class="line"><!---->            perror("unlinkat('to-unlink')");<!----></span><br>            return 1;<span class="line"><!---->            return 1;<!----></span><br>        }<span class="line"><!---->        }<!----></span><br>    } else {<span class="line"><!---->    } else {<!----></span><br>        if (unlinkat(AT_FDCWD, "to-unlink", 0)) {<span class="line"><!---->        if (unlinkat(AT_FDCWD, "to-unlink", 0)) {<!----></span><br>            perror("unlinkat('to-unlink')");<span class="line"><!---->            perror("unlinkat('to-unlink')");<!----></span><br>        }<span class="line"><!---->        }<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br><br>    if (unlinkat(AT_FDCWD, "test-dir", AT_REMOVEDIR)) {<span class="line"><!---->    if (unlinkat(AT_FDCWD, "test-dir", AT_REMOVEDIR)) {<!----></span><br>        perror("unlinkat");<span class="line"><!---->        perror("unlinkat");<!----></span><br>        return 1;<span class="line"><!---->        return 1;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br><br><br>    return 0;<span class="line"><!---->    return 0;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>It returns:<span class="line"><!---->It returns:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>localhost /tmp # /usr/local/bin/rmdir_test <span class="line"><!---->localhost /tmp # /usr/local/bin/rmdir_test <!----></span><br>rmdir: Not a directory<span class="line"><!---->rmdir: Not a directory<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Furthermore if I look for the symlink and its target, both are still there:<span class="line"><!---->Furthermore if I look for the symlink and its target, both are still there:<!----></span><br>d-w-r-xr-T.  2 root    root        40 Mar  3 09:34 test-dir<span class="line"><!---->d-w-r-xr-T.  2 root    root        40 Mar  3 09:34 test-dir<!----></span><br>lrwxrwxrwx.  1 root    root         8 Mar  3 09:34 to-unlink -> test-dir<span class="line"><!---->lrwxrwxrwx.  1 root    root         8 Mar  3 09:34 to-unlink -&gt; test-dir<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        #c22<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c22"><!---->#c22<!----></a>: The expectation is the symlink is part of the path, not the final component, e.g /a/b/c where b is a symlink and c is to-be-deleted. In the above PoC the EXPLOIT directory is a symlink and .../EXPLOIT/agetty.reload is the deletion target.<span class="line"><!---->: The expectation is the symlink is part of the path, not the final component, e.g /a/b/c where b is a symlink and c is to-be-deleted. In the above PoC the EXPLOIT directory is a symlink and .../EXPLOIT/agetty.reload is the deletion target.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Here is a possible fix, but we would still probably need to move other usage of libchrome's DeletePath and DeleteFile over to the newer functions in libbrillo.<span class="line"><!---->Here is a possible fix, but we would still probably need to move other usage of libchrome's DeletePath and DeleteFile over to the newer functions in libbrillo.<!----></span><br><br>We could see if libchrome would pick up the fixed versions, but that is a harder sell because Chrome doesn't have to worry about UID privilege escalation (except maybe in user namespaces).<span class="line"><!---->We could see if libchrome would pick up the fixed versions, but that is a harder sell because Chrome doesn't have to worry about UID privilege escalation (except maybe in user namespaces).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

href="https://crrev.com/2304204086d92dc10d8921cf5d3acc8770018075"><!---->2304204086d92dc10d8921cf5d3acc8770018075<!----></a><br>Author: Allen Webb <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Allen Webb &lt;<!----></span>allenwebb@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/allenwebb@google.com"><!---->allenwebb@google.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Mar 03 19:15:03 2023<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Mar 03 19:15:03 2023<!----></span><br><br>cryptohome: Swap out base::Delete* with brillo::Delete*<span class="line"><!---->cryptohome: Swap out base::Delete* with brillo::Delete*<!----></span><br><br>Use SafeFD rather than libchrome to do delete operations because<span class="line"><!---->Use SafeFD rather than libchrome to do delete operations because<!----></span><br>recursion is prone to ToCToU races.<span class="line"><!---->recursion is prone to ToCToU races.<!----></span><br><br>BUG=chromium:1398990<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1398990" title="Security: ChromeOS Arbitrary Root File Delete"><!---->BUG=chromium:1398990<!----></a><br>TEST=FEATURES=test emerge-${BOARD} cryptohome<span class="line"><!---->TEST=FEATURES=test emerge-${BOARD} cryptohome<!----></span><br><br>Change-Id: Ic7ad683e0feefa60db37296be56c028baa4a5ce8<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: Ic7ad683e0feefa60db37296be56c028baa4a5ce8<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromiumos/platform2/+/4310163<a         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/16a89e616b763ed03b758202816bb83a0d62e144<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/16a89e616b763ed03b758202816bb83a0d62e144"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/16a89e616b763ed03b758202816bb83a0d62e144<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>16a89e616b763ed03b758202816bb83a0d62e144<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/16a89e616b763ed03b758202816bb83a0d62e144"><!---->16a89e616b763ed03b758202816bb83a0d62e144<!----></a><br>Author: Allen Webb <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Allen Webb &lt;<!----></span>allenwebb@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/allenwebb@google.com"><!---->allenwebb@google.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Mar 08 16:51:51 2023<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Mar 08 16:51:51 2023<!----></span><br><br>[M108-LTS] libbrillo: SafeFD ignore some ENOENT during recursive Rmdir<span class="line"><!---->[M108-LTS] libbrillo: SafeFD ignore some ENOENT during recursive Rmdir<!----></span><br><br>This does not return an error when ENOENT is encountered for contents<span class="line"><!---->This does not return an error when ENOENT is encountered for contents<!----></span><br>during a recursive Rmdir. We do not want ENOENT for contents being<span class="line"><!---->during a recursive Rmdir. We do not want ENOENT for contents being<!----></span><br>conflated with ENOENT for the target directory. This should make this<span class="line"><!---->conflated with ENOENT for the target directory. This should make this<!----></span><br>less prone to failure when multiple processes are deleting overlapping<span class="line"><!---->less prone to failure when multiple processes are deleting overlapping<!----></span><br>paths.<span class="line"><!---->paths.<!----></span><br><br>This also stops logging errors when Rmdir is called for a file since<span class="line"><!---->This also stops logging errors when Rmdir is called for a file since<!----></span><br>that is an expected case in brillo::DeleteFile.<span class="line"><!---->that is an expected case in brillo::DeleteFile.<!----></span><br><br>BUG=chromium:1398990<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1398990" title="Security: ChromeOS Arbitrary Root File Delete"><!---->BUG=chromium:1398990<!----></a><br>TEST=FEATURES=test emerge libbrillo<span class="line"><!---->TEST=FEATURES=test emerge libbrillo<!----></span><br><br>Change-Id: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromiumos/platform2/+/4320545<a class="undefined" target="_blank" <<span class="line"><!---->Tested-by: Allen Webb &lt;<!----></span>allenwebb@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/allenwebb@google.com"><!---->allenwebb@google.com<!----></a>><span
