          Comment 5<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1398990#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      lziest@google.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/3930847549" title="lziest@google.com"><!---->lziest@google.com<!----></a>
      lziest@google.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->lziest@google.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Wed, Dec 7, 2022, 6:42 PM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Dec 7, 2022, 6:42 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1398990#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Dec 7, 2022, 6:42 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1398990#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Dec 7, 2022, 6:42 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        I am not familiar with FileEnumerator's flag behavior. The SHOW_SYM_LINK flag is on for FileEnumerator. When a directory is a symlink to /run, will FileEnumerator follows the link throught the Next() call? No because the directory is actually becoming a symlink file. So the race is that:<span class="line"><!---->I am not familiar with FileEnumerator's flag behavior. The SHOW_SYM_LINK flag is on for FileEnumerator. When a directory is a symlink to /run, will FileEnumerator follows the link throught the Next() call? No because the directory is actually becoming a symlink file. So the race is that:<!----></span><br>1. FileEnumerator checks a directory D can be traversed.<span class="line"><!---->1. FileEnumerator checks a directory D can be traversed.<!----></span><br>2. FileEnumerator enters the directory D.<span class="line"><!---->2. FileEnumerator enters the directory D.<!----></span><br>3. FileEnumerator traverses the files of D and starts to call unlink($D/filename) on each file.<span class="line"><!---->3. FileEnumerator traverses the files of D and starts to call unlink($D/filename) on each file.<!----></span><br><br>if we change the directory D to a symlink of any other directory, between step 2 and 3 the $D/filename is pointing to some other files. <span class="line"><!---->if we change the directory D to a symlink of any other directory, between step 2 and 3 the $D/filename is pointing to some other files. <!----></span><br><br>Not sure if unlinkat() is a better replacement of unlink.<span class="line"><!---->Not sure if unlinkat() is a better replacement of unlink.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>
      
      
      
        
          Comment 6<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1398990#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

        lziest: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<span class="line"><!---->lziest: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<!----></span><br><br>If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<span class="line"><!---->If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<!----></span><br><br>If the issue is fixed or you can't reproduce it, please close the bug.         This doesn't reproduce for me using rmdir directly. I wrote the following minimal PoC:<span class="line"><!---->This doesn't reproduce for me using rmdir directly. I wrote the following minimal PoC:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>#include <assert.h><span class="line"><!---->#include &lt;assert.h&gt;<!----></span><br>#include <fcntl.h><span class="line"><!---->#include &lt;fcntl.h&gt;<!----></span><br>#include <stdio.h><span class="line"><!---->#include &lt;stdio.h&gt;<!----></span><br>#include <unistd.h><span class="line"><!---->#include &lt;unistd.h&gt;<!----></span><br><br>#include <sys/stat.h><span class="line"><!---->#include &lt;sys/stat.h&gt;<!----></span><br><br>int main() {<span class="line"><!---->int main() {<!----></span><br>    if (mkdirat(AT_FDCWD, "test-dir", 700)) {<span class="line"><!---->    if (mkdirat(AT_FDCWD, "test-dir", 700)) {<!----></span><br>        perror("mkdirat");<span class="line"><!---->        perror("mkdirat");<!----></span><br>        return 1;<span class="line"><!---->        return 1;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br><br>    if (symlinkat("test-dir", AT_FDCWD, "to-unlink")) {<span class="line"><!---->    if (symlinkat("test-dir", AT_FDCWD, "to-unlink")) {<!----></span><br>        perror("symlinkat");<span class="line"><!---->        perror("symlinkat");<!----></span><br>        return 1;<span class="line"><!---->        return 1;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br><br>    if (rmdir("to-unlink")) {<span class="line"><!---->    if (rmdir("to-unlink")) {<!----></span><br>        perror("rmdir");<span class="line"><!---->        perror("rmdir");<!----></span><br>        return 1;<span class="line"><!---->        return 1;<!----></span><br>        if (unlinkat(AT_FDCWD, "to-unlink", 0)) {<span class="line"><!---->        if (unlinkat(AT_FDCWD, "to-unlink", 0)) {<!----></span><br>            perror("unlinkat('to-unlink')");<span class="line"><!---->            perror("unlinkat('to-unlink')");<!----></span><br>            return 1;<span class="line"><!---->            return 1;<!----></span><br>        }<span class="line"><!---->        }<!----></span><br>    } else {<span class="line"><!---->    } else {<!----></span><br>        if (unlinkat(AT_FDCWD, "to-unlink", 0)) {<span class="line"><!---->        if (unlinkat(AT_FDCWD, "to-unlink", 0)) {<!----></span><br>            perror("unlinkat('to-unlink')");<span class="line"><!---->            perror("unlinkat('to-unlink')");<!----></span><br>        }<span class="line"><!---->        }<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br><br>    if (unlinkat(AT_FDCWD, "test-dir", AT_REMOVEDIR)) {<span class="line"><!---->    if (unlinkat(AT_FDCWD, "test-dir", AT_REMOVEDIR)) {<!----></span><br>        perror("unlinkat");<span class="line"><!---->        perror("unlinkat");<!----></span><br>        return 1;<span class="line"><!---->        return 1;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br><br><br>    return 0;<span class="line"><!---->    return 0;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>It returns:<span class="line"><!---->It returns:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>localhost /tmp # /usr/local/bin/rmdir_test <span class="line"><!---->localhost /tmp # /usr/local/bin/rmdir_test <!----></span><br>rmdir: Not a directory<span class="line"><!---->rmdir: Not a directory<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Furthermore if I look for the symlink and its target, both are still there:<span class="line"><!---->Furthermore if I look for the symlink and its target, both are still there:<!----></span><br>d-w-r-xr-T.  2 root    root        40 Mar  3 09:34 test-dir<span class="line"><!---->d-w-r-xr-T.  2 root    root        40 Mar  3 09:34 test-dir<!----></span><br>lrwxrwxrwx.  1 root    root         8 Mar  3 09:34 to-unlink -> test-dir<span class="line"><!---->lrwxrwxrwx.  1 root    root         8 Mar  3 09:34 to-unlink -&gt; test-dir<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        #c22<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c22"><!---->#c22<!----></a>: The expectation is the symlink is part of the path, not the final component, e.g /a/b/c where b is a symlink and c is to-be-deleted. In the above PoC the EXPLOIT directory is a symlink and .../EXPLOIT/agetty.reload is the deletion target.<span class="line"><!---->: The expectation is the symlink is part of the path, not the final component, e.g /a/b/c where b is a symlink and c is to-be-deleted.         Here is a possible fix, but we would still probably need to move other usage of libchrome's DeletePath and DeleteFile over to the newer functions in libbrillo.<span class="line"><!---->Here is a possible fix, but we would still probably need to move other usage of libchrome's DeletePath and DeleteFile over to the newer functions in libbrillo.<!----></span><br><br>We could see if libchrome would pick up the fixed versions, but that is a harder sell because Chrome doesn't have to worry about UID privilege escalation (except maybe in user namespaces).<span class="line"><!---->We could see if libchrome would pick up the fixed versions, but that is a harder sell because Chrome doesn't have to worry about UID privilege escalation (except maybe in user namespaces).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/b8a5d418ef2f67a5864a28cf9cc5bcb31c46e4b9<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/b8a5d418ef2f67a5864a28cf9cc5bcb31c46e4b9"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/b8a5d418ef2f67a5864a28cf9cc5bcb31c46e4b9<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>b8a5d418ef2f67a5864a28cf9cc5bcb31c46e4b9<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/b8a5d418ef2f67a5864a28cf9cc5bcb31c46e4b9"><!---->b8a5d418ef2f67a5864a28cf9cc5bcb31c46e4b9<!----></a><br>Author: Allen Webb <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Allen Webb &lt;<!----></span>allenwebb@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/allenwebb@google.com"><!---->allenwebb@google.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Mar 08 16:51:51 2023<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Mar 08 16:51:51 2023<!----></span><br><br>libbrillo: SafeFD ignore some ENOENT during recursive Rmdir<span class="line"><!---->libbrillo: SafeFD ignore some ENOENT during recursive Rmdir<!----></span><br><br>This does not return an error when ENOENT is encountered for contents<span class="line"><!---->This does not return an error when ENOENT is encountered for contents<!----></span><br>during a recursive Rmdir. We do not want ENOENT for contents being<span class="line"><!---->during a recursive Rmdir. We do not want ENOENT for contents being<!----></span><br>conflated with ENOENT for the target directory. This should make this<span class="line"><!---->conflated with ENOENT for the target directory. This should make this<!----></span><br>less prone to failure when multiple processes are deleting overlapping<span class="line"><!---->less prone to failure when multiple processes are deleting overlapping<!----></span><br>paths.<span class="line"><!---->paths.<!----></span><br><br>This also stops logging errors when Rmdir is called for a file since<span class="line"><!---->This also stops logging errors when Rmdir is called for a file since<!----></span><br>that is an expected case in brillo::DeleteFile.<span class="line"><!---->that is an expected case in brillo::DeleteFile.<!----></span><br><br>BUG=chromium:1398990<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1398990" title="Security: ChromeOS Arbitrary Root File Delete"><!---->BUG=chromium:1398990<!----></a><br>TEST=FEATURES=test emerge libbrillo<span class="line"><!---->TEST=FEATURES=test emerge libbrillo<!----></span><br><br>Change-Id: I3d8ceba935d3133f41c2837aff3caf4d4c636050<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I3d8ceba935d3133f41c2837aff3caf4d4c636050<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromiumos/platform2/+/4320545<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromiumos/platform2/+/4320545"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromiumos/platform2/+/4320545<!----></a><br>Reviewed-by: Brian Norris <<span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-by: Brian Norris &lt;<!----></span>briannorris@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/briannorris@chromium.org"><!---->briannorris@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Tested-by: Allen Webb <<span class="line"><!---->Tested-by: Allen Webb         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money.         This issue requires additional review before it can be merged to the LTS channel. Please answer the following questions to help us evaluate this merge:<span class="line"><!---->This issue requires additional review before it can be merged to the LTS channel. libchrome's delete operations because its recursion<!----></span><br>is prone to ToCToU races.<span class="line"><!---->is prone to ToCToU races.<!----></span><br><br>BUG=chromium:1398990<a            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

    <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>

        for LitElement.

          <input type="text" name="newHotlistName">
        </div>
        
      <br>
      
    
        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Discard
          <chops-button class="de-emphasized discard-button">
            Discard
          </chops-button>
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          </chops-button>

          <chops-button class="de-emphasized discard-button">

          </chops-button>

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
